did.abstract: New York City People's Life Fund and NYC War Tax Resistance, were founding in the 1970s in direct response to the Vietnam War. The organizations provide information, support and counseling to those New Yorkers considering war tax resistance and to those involved with war tax resistance, as well as recahenneling resisted war tax money and contributions to communities that are underserved by government. The collection contains correspondence, pamphlets and flyers, bulletins, newsletters, grant applications and legal documents.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donated by the New York City People's Life Fund and New York City War Tax Resistance in 2004. The accession number 2004.023 is associated with this gift.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials to the People's Life Fund, NYC War Tax Resistance, and the National War Tax Resistance Coordinating Committee. The collection contains correspondence, pamphlets and flyers, bulletins, newsletters, grant applications and legal documents. There are a sunstantial number of copies of the bulletin "Network News," published by the National War Tax Resistance Coordinating Committee, and "Tax Talk," published by War Tax Resistance. There is also a small amount of material produced by other peace, disarmament and anti-nuclear organizations.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: War tax resistance is a diverse movement of people who refuse to pay part or all of their federal income tax, and/or their phone tax, which is historically associated with war. New York City War Tax Resistance, founded in 1971 in direct response to the Vietnam War, provides information, support and counseling to those New Yorkers considering war tax resistance and to those involved with war tax resistance. The New York City People's Life Fund was was also foudned during the Vietnam War. The Fund rechannels resisted war tax money and contributions to communities that are underserved by government.
